entry.et: Middle English blok, from Middle French & Middle Dutch; Middle French bloc, from Middle Dutch blok; akin to Old High German bloh block

def.dt: :a compact usually solid piece of substantial material especially when worked or altered to serve a particular purpose: as
:the piece of wood on which the neck of a person condemned to be beheaded is laid for execution
:a mold or form on which articles are shaped or displayed
:a hollow rectangular building unit usually of artificial material
:a lightweight usually cubical and solid wooden or plastic building toy that is usually provided in sets
:the casting that contains the cylinders of an internal combustion engine
:starting block
:obstacle
:an obstruction of an opponent's play in sports
:a halting or impeding of the progress or movement of an opponent in football by use of the body
:interruption of normal physiological function (as of a tissue or organ)
:heart block
:local anesthesia (as by injection) produced by interruption of the flow of impulses along a nerve
:interruption or cessation especially of train of thought by competing thoughts or psychological suppression compare writer's block
:head 1 threatened to knock his block off
:a wooden or metal case enclosing one or more pulleys and having a hook, eye, or strap by which it may be attached
:a piece of material (as wood or linoleum) having on its surface a hand-cut design from which impressions are to be printed
:a usually rectangular space (as in a city) enclosed by streets and occupied by or intended for buildings
:the distance along one of the sides of such a block
:a large building divided into separate functional units
:a line of row houses
:a distinctive part of a building or integrated group of buildings
:a platform from which property is sold at auction
:a quantity, number, or section of things dealt with as a unit
:bloc 2
:for sale
:to make unsuitable for passage or progress by obstruction
:blockade
:to hinder the passage, progress, or accomplishment of by or as if by interposing an obstruction
:to shut off from view
:to interfere usually legitimately with (as an opponent) in various games or sports
:to prevent normal functioning or action of
:to restrict the exchange of (as currency or checks)
:to mark or indicate the outline or chief lines of block out a design
:to shape on, with, or as if with a block block a hat
:to secure, support, or provide with a block
:to work out or chart the movements of (as stage performers) often used with out
:to make (two or more lines of writing or type) flush at the left or at both left and right
:to block an opponent in sports
Herbert Lawrence 1909–2001 Her*block bixblo05.wavˈhər-ˌbläk Am. editorial cartoonist
:pulley blocks with associated rope or cable for hoisting or hauling
:a diagram (as of a system, process, or program) in which labeled figures (as rectangles) and interconnecting lines represent the relationship of parts
:an unrestricted federal grant
:an often hand-drawn simple capital letter composed of strokes of uniform thickness
:an outdoor public party put on by the residents of a city block or neighborhood
:a small plane made with the blade set at a lower pitch than other planes and used chiefly on end grains of wood
island Rhode Island in the Atlantic at E entrance to Long Island Sound
